<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 326, 294]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 299, 155, 314]]<|/det|>
Paper 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 278, 905, 333]]<|/det|>
0606/21 May/June 2019 2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 415, 354]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 437, 374]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Electronic calculator  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 715, 431]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 325, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 384, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 282, 516]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 828, 545]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 598, 559]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 603, 574]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 606, 599]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 599, 759, 614]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 613, 440, 628]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 73, 594, 90]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 165, 559, 183]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 196, 233, 214]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 226, 371, 245]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0,\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 242, 571, 282]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 312, 222, 330]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[250, 333, 744, 375]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 380, 479, 419]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 481, 591, 500]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 514, 153, 531]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 542, 580, 610]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 641, 235, 658]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[410, 664, 588, 696]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 717, 590, 770]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\] \[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 472, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(x\) for which \(x(6x + 7) \geqslant 20.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 336, 94, 355]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 333, 556, 363]]<|/det|>
Two variables \(x\) and \(y\) are such that \(y = \frac{\ln x}{x^3}\) for \(x > 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 365, 143, 384]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 364, 235, 384]]<|/det|>
Show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[248, 361, 371, 393]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{1 - 3\ln x}{x^4}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 365, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 662, 141, 680]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 661, 813, 680]]<|/det|>
Hence find the approximate change in \(y\) as \(x\) increases from e to e + \(h\), where \(h\) is small.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 661, 920, 680]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 714, 91]]<|/det|>

<mark>[1]

<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 225, 920, 260]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 242, 920, 260]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 443, 796, 462]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 617, 920, 651]]<|/det|>

<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|>
